alert.note: Alert for Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued November 06 at 2:26PM MST until November 07 at 1:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 1 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of the northern Black Hills of South Dakota, and the northeast Wyoming plains and the Black Hills of Wyoming. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 1 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...The high winds may blow down large trees and damage roofs, small outbuildings, and signs. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Strong winds can cause blowing dust, reduced visibility, and flying debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are expected to be along the I-90 corridor across northeast Wyoming and extend into the northern Black Hills.
info.instruction: Persons outdoors should watch for flying or falling objects that may injure you. If you are driving, be prepared for sudden wind gusts that can cause you to lose control of your vehicle, especially on open stretches, or as you approach the crest of hills. Also be alert for debris or dust blowing across the road.
